messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: More Suzuki info
messages.msgSnippet: Speaking of Suzuki... I just had a random thought. I m wondering if he could have been the character model for another one of the RK characters? You all recall
messages.messageBody:
Speaking of Suzuki... I just had a random thought. I'm wondering if he could
have been the character model for another one of the RK characters? You all
recall Usui, ne? The pathetic fellow who tried and tried to take revenge on
Shishio without success and finally got his sorry tail nailed to the wall by none
other than Saito? Maybe Watsuki-sama was implying that is what would have
happened if the Miki and Saito ever met up agian phil!

-ducks behind Saito-sama to avoid the pelting by rotten vegetables she knows
is coming-

-MissBehavin


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: More Suzuki info
messages.msgSnippet: Saitou to mobs of fangirls waiting outside a teahouse Ladies please, Hijikata has left the building...the Shinsengumi also employs several eligible bachelors
messages.messageBody:
Saitou to mobs of fangirls waiting outside a teahouse "Ladies
please, Hijikata has left the building...the Shinsengumi also
employs several eligible bachelors you can submit applications to
Yamazaki who will be handling the screening process"

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: More Suzuki info
messages.msgSnippet: ... dojo he teaches at at there s this mob of fangirls screaming his name peeking inside trying to get his attention. It was hilarious and I wondered if
messages.messageBody:
>>There's even a scene when he goes tot eh
dojo he teaches at at there's this mob of fangirls screaming his name
peeking inside trying to get his attention. It was hilarious and I
wondered if Hijikata ever had a brush with that.

I think about "Toshizo's parcel"episode.
(It's mentioned here on net; http://www.toshizo.com/jiken/jibody01.html#07
)

[One day Hijikata send a parcel to his birthplace, saying, "I send you
something ectremely precious". When birthplace people open the parcel, they find a
bunch of love letters adressed toToshizo. It make them laugh, and they say,
"Toshi san gains another point!"]

Tama

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: More Suzuki info
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s so funny you should mention that. I received and watched Chusingura 1/47 yesterday about the 47 ronin and in the beginning one of the guys who becomes
messages.messageBody:
secretary wrote:

>(sigh)...all this talk about eyes/glare of doom ^_^ makes me think
>of Hijikata's pic...he's staring into the distance...I wonder how
>his glare of doom would be like...probably would make any fangirl
>weak in the knees....LOL!
>
>
It's so funny you should mention that. I received and watched Chusingura
1/47 yesterday about the 47 ronin and in the beginning one of the guys
who becomes one of Asano's retainers and later one of the 47 takes on a
bunch of guys trying to beat a really old samurai. He takes them all out
and the Edo "tabloids" (one sheet flyers complete with gory artwork)
have it that he killed 18 men as opposed to the actual 3. He's a star
and all sorts of people want him to marry their daughters or let them
adopt him into the family etc. There's even a scene when he goes tot eh
dojo he teaches at at there's this mob of fangirls screaming his name
peeking inside trying to get his attention. It was hilarious and I
wondered if Hijikata ever had a brush with that.

--
Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net

messages.subject: Re: More Suzuki info

messages.subject: More Suzuki info
messages.msgSnippet: I just popped over to shinsengumimb and what should be there but a new message in the Sekihoutai forum!  A message from momoiro with a story of how later in
messages.messageBody:
I just popped over to shinsengumimb and what should be there but a new message in the Sekihoutai forum! A message from momoiro with a story of how later in life Suzuki prayed for not only his brother and others, but also Kondou and Hijikata. There was also apparently something written about him by his son-in-law and I *think* the links momoiro provided either are or are derived from an interview with Suzuki's grandson. I got so excited I forgot to copy links and such... :-D Just go on over to http://www.shinsengumimb.com and it's under the Suzuki website topic in the Sekihoutai forum.

Really cool comment (from the grandson, I think, when Suzuki was teaching him kendo) about how Suzuki's eyes shone, too! Suppose it was a requirement for entry into the Shinsengumi? :-D

phil (who feels way too tipsy to be rational right now)
